Ich habe zuerst die Firmware aktualisiert und bin dann zum Testen übergegangen!Ich fand sie zu leise, der Bass ist da, aber nicht wirklich und nicht immer und das Hörerlebnis war insgesamt enttäuschend, da es Zeiten gab, in denen alle Frequenzen in Chaos vermischt schien. Es ist gut möglich, dass ich ein fehlerhaftes Paar Kopfhörer bekommen habe, da ich auch ein paar Bluetooth-Unterbrechungen hatte.

Die Geräuschunterdrückung mit intelligentem Abschalten bei einer unterhaltung funktioniert soweit, der sound hat mich bisher auch nicht enttäuscht. Allerdings ist die Bedienungsanleitung, die Garantiekarte und auch die Verpackung nicht auf deutsch. Für die einzelnen Befehle durch antippen muss ich also im internet schauen. Besonders ärgerlich ist, dass die falsche Farbe geliefert wurde. So kurz vor Weihnachten auf so eine linke Nummer zurückzugreifen nur um Verkäufe zu erzielen finde ich unterirdisch.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 2, 2023
reviewDescription: I really wanted to like these headphones. I've had the original samsung buds for a few years and they have been pretty good. Decent enough sound, have survived lots of bike rides in the rain and trips to the gym. I also have the sony wh xm4 headphones which are fantastic noise quality and the anc is great too. I wanted to upgrade my buds by getting some with more up to date sound quality and anc for use in the gym. The wh xm4s are a bit big for gym use and the original buds aren't noise cancelling. I considered the sony wf xm4s and these buds 2 pro. I went for the buds as they are a higher water resistance and read reviews that the wf xm4s were quite large in the ear. The buds looked sleeker. I also have a samsung galaxy s22 plus mobile and only use headphone with my phone. I was hoping they would be an up to date version of my original buds.First impressions were good. The base was good, punchy and the anc was great. I noticed they didn't fit in my ear as securely as the original buds but they didn't feel like they'd fall out. After trying a few songs with them.I noticed that the higher notes of songs such as snares and 's' in vocals were quite sharp and tinny making the listening experience uncomfortable. The overall sound of the buds also wasn't as warm as the sonys I have. The eq options on the samsung app are limited but I did try some 3rd party apps to see if I could get the buds to sound better by lessening the harshness of the treble, but I couldn't and the sound of them was ruining songs that I really liked listening to with my original buds or sonys. It really is a shame and I'm not sure what is causing this issue. There are quite a few other people having the same issues in forums online. I'm returning them and will go back to the drawing board. Maybe wf xm4s or 5s....Edit - went for the sony wf1000xm5s which are perfect. A fair bit more expensive but worth it. No more harsh trebles or high vocals. Great fit, sound and anc. 5* recommend.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviewDescription: These are great earbuds. Sound quality is there. You can appreciate The different instruments, and there is no lack of bass. I don't feel my ears getting fatigued from the sound of the buds themselves and that is a big plus. 5/5 given the price in that regard.They're super easy to use and connect, you just have to get used to using the wearables app. I also occasionally use them with my PC via Bluetooth and I can even control the settings on there with the same app.The active noise cancelling gets a 4/5 from me. It works great 90% of the time. The only problems I regularly experience with it are if I skateboarding, it will pick up the wind and play even louder than the wind to try to muffle it. Occasionally plays a loud sound when your hair hits the mic if you have longer hair. Overall good and most people won't have these issues.Finally the last point, fit, and the reason it gets an overall 2/5. These DO NOT like to stay in your ears! They will work themselves out with any movement of your head or jaw. The only time these stay in my ears is if I am lying in bed not doing anything. I longboard a lot(eBoard) and the little vibrations in the rode will work them out of my ears in minutes. Walking/running works them out albeit more slowly. Working out does the same if you do any overhead motions. Chewing any sort of food or snack will walk them out of your ears. Talking on the phone will walk them out of your ears. Seriously, any time I move my head or jaw they slide out just a little bit but enough to be annoying, and then fall out if I do more. 0/5 here.I paid a hundred and twenty on sale, and so the quality for the price was there. I love everything but the fit. I kept them past my return window because I have a lot of other headphones and audio gear, so these rarely get use, and I can put up with them for what they are. Perhaps my ears are just built in a way that causes me this problem, but I have talked to several other people in my daily life who experienced the same thing. 2/5

I've never had ear buds before and thought I should have a pair. I bought a pair if the Sony wf 1000xm4.These were the top of the line buds from Sony, I shouldn't have any issues right? Wrong!  They just wouldn't fit properly. Bulky and they wouldnt fit, As a result the sound also suffered. I just wasn't happy at all with them. So I took them back and started the search again.Long story short ....I tried a pair of Samsung Pro buds 2 and love them! the fit is perfect, noise cancelling is excellent in my opinion, and as  a result the sound is great!! Music is clear and very rich, podcasts are as if you were in the room yourself!I highly recommend these!They work well, and are well made .....

reviewTitle: Great buds from samsung highly recommend
reviewDescription: Great buds, i would honestly recommend to any android user.-Noise cancellation is great and also the ambient noise feature also works wonders and is surprisingly sharp-App is user friendly and is downloaded on both android and PC, I've downloaded the app on my pc and i can easily switch and use the buds from my pc or my phone.-Integrated greatly with any android phone. I have a Google Pixel Phone and with the app its like if it was part of the ecosystem.
I used a bunch of buds from Apple, Sony, and Samsung . But so far these ones are the best, the sound quality is great the fit is great, and they are pretty much stealth as compared to Sony or Apple

reviewTitle: One of the best earphones on the market
reviewDescription: They are one of the best earphones i have every tried, they have lots of features they fit pretty well in your ear , the sound is clean , but most importantly is the ammount of fearures inside this small thing , and the noise cancelling is very good that it actually feels super weirnd using it
Comfortable, not do price for what you get, the sounds is ASTOUNDING, i went from the wf xm3 to them and ill say i dont regret it one second. Totally worth the purchase

The Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro 2 are a revelation in the audio realm. The sound quality is unparalleled, from crisp highs to deep lows, giving a truly balanced audio experience. The active noise-cancellation is impeccable, allowing for an immersive listening environment. They connect flawlessly with no hitches. While the touch controls can be sensitive, the accompanying app offers an option to turn touch off, showcasing their user-centric design. These earbuds are a premium audio essential for anyone seeking the best.

reviewTitle: How are these cheaper than MSRP??
reviewDescription: I purchased these over other sellers on Amazon and brick and mortar retailers because of their lower than MSRP price. They arrived are 100% legitimate! Definitely recommend this seller for these Buds 2 Pro. Less $ than any local retailer, including on boxing day.
J'ai un cellulaire Samsung  et les écouteurs fonctionnent à merveille.
Sounds perfection

I LOVE these! These are THE best TWE's I've ever owned, lighter and much more svelte than the AirPods Pro's 1 & 2, and equally deep, quality unmuffled bass as the older Sony WMF-1000X3's I super love the 24-bit Hi-Res Audio capability and connection reliability with my Galaxy S23's, and the auto ambient enabled by simply talking. You need to enable this in Galaxy Wear app that comes pre-installed and you get to choose between 5, 10, 15 seconds after conversation stops for Ambient Sound to auto disable.Like the AirPods Pro's you'll forget these are in your ears if Ambient Sound is ON/OFF (along with ANC Off). Yet the ear canal seal is more closely fit with my tiny ears - earlobe to top of my ear is 6cm lol. Usually I would use small ear tips but medium proved to be a "good/secure fit" via testing, but head shake proves too loose. Using small resolved that for me.

reviewTitle: Quality is amazing but shipping missed one step
reviewDescription: overall first impressions of the galaxy buds2 pro, the product is amazing, i ordered with 2 day shipping and it arrived on time. the packaging could’ve come with some sort of padding or bubble wrap or something but it didn’t. other than that, the product is brand new, paired up with my phone and plays great sound. sounds better than airpods in my opinion, but that’s a biased thing. i’ll update my experience later on when i have some more time with it.
They're amazing! Everything works as intended. The only thing is that the battery isn't great but everything else is really good. ANC works really well and it has an auto detecting speech.
Sounds good and microphone works well. Hs fallen out of my ear when I do strenuous stuff. Noise canceling cuts out on nearby conversations when they are not talking to me.

I was a (relatively) happy user of Galaxy Buds+ until I lost them about a week ago and bought a set of Buds2 Pro as a replacemet. This review will focus on major differences between Buds+ and Buds2 Pro.Sound quality: compared to Buds+, Buds2 Pro's sound quality is significantly improved. Bass receives the biggest improvement, making the low end punchy without distortion at higher volume. Mids and highs are slightly improved, producing crisp sound and good separation between instruments and vocals. The soundstage is also much better in the Buds2 Pro, improving immersion.  Buds2 Pro offers 360 degree head tracking but this is mainly a gimmick in my opinion, and not a feature worth upgrading for alone.Volume: Buds2 Pro max volume is significantly louder than Buds+. I had use an app to increase maximum volume on my Buds+.  Buds2 Pro's max volume is uncomfortably loud and unless you suffer from hearing loss, you won't be disappointed with this aspect. I'm not sure if the volume increase is due to active noise cancellation or tighter fit but it's there all the same.ANC / Ambient Sound: speaking of active noise cancellation, Buds2 Pro's implementation is excellent and a reason alone to upgrade from Buds+ which lacked this feature.  Noise cancellation blocks out all but the loudest ambient noise and really separates you from the outside world.  It's great for concentrating in a noisy environment like an office and I imagine it would be excellent during flights.  Buds2 Pro also has an ambient sound mode which pipes in external sound using an array of microphones. This generally works well but louder sounds and excessive wind can overwhelm the microphones and create high pitched distortion which is not pleasant. There's an option to detect speech automatically and lower the volume so you can have a conversation without pausing or removing the buds. I quickly turned this off because it was sensitive and consantly cut in when I didn't want it to.Size and comfort: this is another area where Buds2 Pro received a significant upgrade. Compared to Buds+, Buds2 Pro are lighter, smaller and more comfortable. The Buds2 Pro fit snugly and form a tight seal in the ear, which improves sound quality and noise cancellation. I find the Buds2 Pro are much less likely to fall out during movement than Buds+ which were annoyingly loose no matter the combination of wingtips and eartips. This does depend on individual fit so your mileage may vary.Battery life: while the actual buds have similar battery life, the Buds2 Pro's case battery has more capacity and can quick charge one hour in five minutes. This is a great feature if you need a quick top-up before a workout or phone call.Overall: the Buds2 Pro are a worthy upgreade from Buds+ in most areas. In particular, the sound quality, noise cancellation, volume, fit and charging are significantly improved in Buds2 Pro. I bought these on sale for $220 AUD which is a good price for what you get. At the recommended price of $320 AUD, they are a harder sell as this is similar price point to excellent alternatives from Sony, Apple and "audiophile" brands.

reviewTitle: Such great sound, painful design for smaller ears
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2023
reviewDescription: This earbuds are absolutely incredible for the cost differential; pay a bit more, massive upgrade in sound quality.I have nice speakers and decent wired over-ears at home, but with my partner and I both working hybrid schedules, I usually listen to music and podcasts with my earbuds in. I always told myself I'd just use my speakers, but being able to have just one bud in so I'm not walking around the house like an oblivious wad is irresistible. The wireless convenience calls to me. However, I've never been so much of a noise geek that I was going to pay for nicer wireless earbuds. Still, the reality of the situation is that I use earbuds an overwhelming amount of the time.Because of this, it crept up slowly that I've hardly been listening to music. I had the older, non-pro Galaxy buds 2 for years- replaced once with the same model to have spares without an upgrade- and while I loved the look and feel of them and they were serviceable, the sound was not great. Audio for calls was sometimes terrible, and I was unintelligible half the time. They fell out of my ears if I was running, although not so abruptly I couldn't fix the positioning and prevent them from popping out with a free hnad. Ultimately, none of these issues were enough to make me want to upgrade to the bulkier, more expensive Pro earbuds. Still, when my older headphones started to get finicky again, I eventually bit the bullet, thinking I might just get more of the non-Pros anyway.It was amazing. These are the first earbuds I've owned where the sound quality was worth even listening to music on, and that's when I realized immediately how much more I'd be listening to. They have great, rich, dynamic sound. I didn't love the look of the exterior speaker on the larger buds, but I 180'd as soon as I heard the results- obviously, it was worth it.They were so much bigger that they looked a little goofy in my ears. Not a big deal, worth the effect and good noise that came out of them. I've been very excited.Unfortunately, I like having background noise running for much of my workday, and my partner and I often have different listening priorities. This is a problem because I quickly realized that, if worn for an extended period of time, these are physically painful on the cartilage of my ears. No matter how I positioned them, if I wore them for a few hours, my ears (specifically, whatever you call the curve of cartilage above the lobe) get sore to the touch for hours or days. Seemingly, I can get about an hour of listening out of these a day. That's a downer, as I didn't buy them thinking I'd have to restrict my use of them as aggressively as my parents tried to limit my screen time in the early 2000s.On the plus side, they still sound great, and my old headphones ended their time on the fritz, so I've just gone back to them. I can wear these around the house where my options are ample, and in theory, I'll probably still use them. I'm holding out secret hope that I can slowly damage the cartilage of my ears enough that I can wear them longer, but for now, I'm punished with seriously tender ear-tissue that lasts for days and bothers me even if I switch headphones or earbuds.Long and short of it, they sound great. They're massively worth the money if you're considering an upgrade from the regular galaxy 2's for the pro's (although I still prefer the smaller, simpler look aesthetically). They even stopped falling out of my ears when I'm on a run with this new design. Unfortunately, be cautious if your ear-holes aren't on the larger side and you aren't willing to gauge a weird part of your ears as part of the bargain.
Me encanta el sonido

reviewTitle: Will not pair with Galaxy Note 9
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviewDescription: Just a warning, these buds will not pair with a Galaxy Note 9.  The phone sees a serial number (not the name of the product) and fails to pair.The buds will pair with a Galaxy 6 classic watch, but since neither the buds nor the watch come with documentation, it took some sleuthing to find a solution that worked.  As so:The buds go into pairing mode when the case is opened.  Best practices is to leave the case on a charger for an hour or so before first trying to pair.From the watch, go to setup -> connections -> bluetooth.  Turn on bluetooth if not on.Open the case for the earbuds.  This starts the pairing process.When the buds name come up in the watch display, touch it.  You should be paired at that point.Save yourself some trouble and put the Galaxy Buds Pro app in the Tiles screen so you can find it easily.Go to the Galaxy Buds Pro app.Note that you need to have the buds firmly seated in your ears for the noise cancellation to work.  Like, really firmly.You'll notice when the buds are seated firmly enough because the "noise cancellation" button will no longer be greyed out and the sound quality improves dramatically.One final note:  These buds are only as good as the source.  If the music source is highly compressed, the buds will sound tinny.  With a good music source and with the buds seated properly they seem decent.There doesn't seem to be any kind of mixer app on the watch, so you can't do things like bring up the bass or fix the treble.  I'd love to be wrong on this but I have not found any way to change the mixture.  A lot of the music on the Amazon Music app sounds tinny as a result.  If that's your experience, it's not you.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviewDescription: ...for some reason, even with the same size rubber tips, this pair does not fit as well as my Buds+. I like the noise cancelling and the idea of being able to listen to music and have them automatically mute (or turn down the volume of the music - I forget) is pretty cool in the right situation (Voice Detect). I like the base response and the different EQ presets. The ambient sound functionality also works very well. 360 Audio is a pretty cool feature too. Yeah its gimmicky but a cool gimmick!Double/Triple-tap works well. Reading my text messages to me is GREAT!As you can tell, because I don't remember exactly what that feature does, it isn't useful for my needs. I guess if you are walking around Walmart by yourself shopping it would work perfectly. 95% of the time you are doing your own thing in silence but when you need to ask where something is located it would switch back-and-forth appropriately. I typically only wear these while at my bowling league. I want to hear MY music and I am not there to chit-chat but others are. So while they know I am wearing them their conversation causes them to shut on/off too frequently.

reviewTitle: Buds are great but cord has 2 type C ends
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
reviewDescription: I've had these Galaxy ear buds just a short time & haven't used all the features yet so can't review those.  The ear buds themselves are super -- they connect to my Samsung phone easily & have good range & sound.  However -- when they arrived, the cord that  came with them had C-type connectors on both ends & no USB end. I navigated through the painful help screens to report the issue -- none of the supplied click options apply, so I needed to find someplace to just type in my wish to get a regular type C USB cord rather than the double ended  cord that I found unusable.  Finally found a chat screen & the helpful fellow said he would just send me a whole new box - buds, extra rubber ear things, and cord.  Well.  When the new box came, that cord had 2 C ends too.  I was told that I could use it with 'any brick type Samsung charger.'  I was uninformed - didn't know what that was - so after researching I learned that it's just a regular wall plug in like the ones for USB cords, but with a type C port instead.  i could get one for $20 or $25 - or more if so inclined.  A whole new charger that  had only one purpose  -- to charge my Samsung ear buds?  Rather than using any of maybe a dozen regular USB chargers that I already have?  Does not make sense to me.  So I went to Walmart & bought an extra $5.98 USB cord. Summary: the buds are great, but recognize that you'll get a cord that won't be usable unless you have or get a specific charger for it.

reviewTitle: Good Sound, Miniscule Battery Life (update not a battery problem - my error)
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviewDescription: **I am updating my review because I discovered what I thought was a battery issue was an intermittent connectivity problem with my laptop that resembled battery problem. I'm not sure if I have it fixed for good, but I am confident that I can recommend these ear buds.I have hearing loss and so watch all my TV etc on my laptop. Because of the pathetic battery life of these, I keep a pair of wired Bose earbuds nearby because fully charged these just go dead after 2 hours. I can't get one evening of use in before they quit. They don't gradually run down, they just quit like flipping a switch. I bought them 7 months ago so I'm stuck with them. Would I buy again? Probably at 1/2 price or less, no more than that

These are good value for the money. The noise cancellation isn't great unless they happen to fit your ear perfectly (which mine do not). IMPORTANT: The reason I'm leaving this review is to let you all know that if you lose your case (as is bound to happen), it's a virtually impossible to get a replacement! You'll have to go to an authorized Samsung repair centre (with proof of purchase) to buy a replacement and have it paired to your earbuds. I live in a major city and they have none in stock. The store employee offered to sell me his case for $200. Go with another brand.

reviewTitle: Purchase from an authorized Samsung dealer or you won't get warranty service .
reviewDescription: I purchased them from TrustedTechCanada online store. The earbuds pro 2 aren't warrantied because they are made in Lebanon. The company won't respond to my messages.  Beware
You won't be able to get American buds serviced in Canada. Buy at your own risk. I'm out of $200, as ANC has failed to work after 2 months.

I've had this product for barely over a month and the sound quality is almost gone. I cannot recommend this product to anyone as it was hardly used and the sound is almost silent. There are cheaper products out there with similar performance that came last 2 or more years like the Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro my friend bought.
They don't stay in your ears. Tried all the tips. No matter how you adjust them or what you do they will fall out in 20 mins or less.

reviewTitle: Don't buy. Doesn't work since its a version from Lebanon not North America
reviewDescription: This model is cheaper than the official Samsung one because its from Lebanon. Did not work with my North American Samsung S21 Ultra. Buds from other countries do not have valid warranties in North America either. Avoid this.
The left side doesn't work
These buds failed after three weeks. Samsung said these are not an Australian product and therefore not covered under warranty in Australia.  I will not buy from here again.

reviewTitle: Fall out of ears, Bluetooth keeps disconnecting
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 27, 2023
reviewDescription: The quality of sounds is good however they don't sound as good as I expected, I moved from the buds plus to the buds2 pro, and I much prefer the buds plus as the sound quality for me is not much different, however the buds pro fall out of my ear even without walking, on top of that the keep disconnecting from my Samsung galaxy s22, multiple times an hour.

Venían perfectamente, no parecían maltratados y aun cuando parecían originales, una vez los abrí me di cuenta que el audífono de la izquierda tiene una calidad horrible y el derecho no sirve, no carga y ni siquiera se conecta, esto es una estafa

These are excellent earbuds that provide amazing sound and bass. However, I couldn't get them to not slip out of my ears. I tried switching the tips a bunch of times but they kept falling out from time to time. That made me think too much about them all the time. I returned them and received a full refund. 👍
That's about it. Not too thrilled with the sound quality. The bass is weak and the mids are little empty.
It tends to pause etc. When I just want to push it in my ears more.  Still better than my old bose ear buds.
Inconvenient to swap between bluetooth devices.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviewDescription: Pros... They work like a charm. No issues with connection. I had a pair of JBLs which had more problems than a math book. These are OK, but not great. Noise canceling is good when they are jammed in your ear. They charge easy and give me no issues.Cons... They fall out of my ear when exercising. When I adjust them they shut off. They are finicky when dealing with noise canceling. They have to be jammed in my ear and the contacts need to be touching in order for noise canceling to work. The sound quality is lacking compared to JBL and SONY.

reviewTitle: They sound great but they have a huge issue with wind noise
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviewDescription: They fit and sound great. The active noise reduction works well. But the biggest problem with these is when you turn on the ambient sound setting, it picks up a huge amount of wind noise. I was trying them out outside and there was a light breeze. It may as well have been a flat-out hurricane it was so loud. Trying to have a conversation with the ambient setting turned on would be impossible. The older version had a slider setting in the app to mitigate this, but these newer one are all or nothing.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 5, 2023
reviewDescription: I have cheaper earphones with better sound. I'm not blown away by them at all. I fact, I am really close to send them back. The battery on the case doesn't last a long time and if you want your buds battery to last then you have to switch off the fancy noise reduction and other stuff. Like I said, I was expecting a lot more from them but I'm disappointed.I was reading other reviews and I agree with the people that say about "s" sounds and highs are the most annoying.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviewDescription: I've had these earbuds for about 2 months now and I'm honestly regretting my purchase.Pros: they look nice, good sound quality, good ambient sound dampener, fits ears very well.Cons: the mic to speak in is placed in such a way that to speak clearly to people using these earbuds, you will have to rotate them in your ear so that the mic is not covered by a part of your ear, otherwise it will be muffled, making it sound terrible for the person on the other end. This wouldn't be a big deal, but when you rotate them to speak, they don't sit properly in your ears anymore and you can hear more ambient sounds. Would be perfect if the mic was placed in a different spot slightly, so that you don't have to fight with this all the time.The price is way too high for what you get.The battery life is GARBAGE! It says like 6-8 hours or something? As if, more like 3-4 hours and I'm just listening to music at half volume.I love Samsung products overall but in my opinion, these are not worth the $120 price tag.

reviewTitle: Everyone I call complains about the background noise.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviewDescription: The software and ear buds are wonderfully designed. Kudos to Samsung. Unfortunately, the noise cancellation allows all background noise to be heard by people I call.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviewDescription: Sound quality is good, noise cancelation is good, but they won't stay in my ear and they become very uncomfortable after a while..

Using it for two days and so far it doesn't disappoint! At first, I did have some problems with connecting to the app, once had to reset everything and start again. But after updating firmware (don't put it in the case!) everything is very smooth.Pros:+The sound is perfect. I'm by no means an audiophile; for me it sounds great.+The mic is crystal clear even outside under moderate wind conditions.+Adaptive noise cancelling works well. You are not as in a soundproof studio, but will filter out nuisance sounds well.+Simultaneous connection to two devices with a possibility of paring up to 6(!) devices in total. You may use app to switch between them (leaving phone always connected). For my work workflow works very well.+Each of the buds can be used separately. Either left or right works without the other one. Very nice, if using for handsfree, you can have one charging and another in use. There is some blackout when switching, but it's only a second or two.+Fits well, do not comes out even when jumping.Cons:-Case is bulky. Can't carry in a pocket as it is sticking out significantly.-No way to know the charge level without opening the case. If charging buds without power cable, the led turns off. Not critical buy a bit annoying.-Battery is not enough for a full day, but it's fast to charge and you can alternate buds if needed for calls.-Some of functions require an account, but I can live without them. (Sound zones and personalized sound)-EQ switching is not user friendly. You can't quickly (single push) change presets.-No mute for mic. Can be useful for business usage while conferencing a lot.-Would be useful to be able to lock the touch commands right from buds.All Pros outweigh Cons, at least for me. Very please with build and sound quality, seamless multidevice support, good ANC.Will update after more usage.

I heard some horror stories with these. How they can have connection issues and fall apart. But like others have said, these are one of the best sound earbuds probably to come out, and note best sounding. They won't have the best noise cancelling or transparency mode. I think Samsung, Google or Apple earbuds still take cakes for those segments due to their excellence in software but Sennheiser didn't slouch still. They can block out noise decently and still offer great transparency. I will say, transparency mode gives off this white noise sound, which may turn some people, but I can bear it for a couple minutes. You can lessen this white noise effect if you turn transparency mode to a low setting in the Sennheiser app. Speaking of the app, I find it very great. The personal EQ was very fancy and made my sound setting much better. I like that we can bind our control taps for different controls. Although I wish I could change the controls for volume. I want a tap for volume and not a tap and hold but maybe a future update perhaps. I have run into some connection issues, very minor sometimes, the earbuds just start dropping, cut in and out. I just pop my earbuds in the case and out, have them reconnect. Simple fix for now. Overall, my experience with them is great overall. If they fix the white noise thing and these small connection issues, this earbud would be a step closer to being flawless.

I tried Bose QC2, sony, AirPods Pro but I stopped at senheisser. Why??? The sound is awesome, the fit is great, mic quality is ok(not greatttttt). The apps easy to use, but the only awesome thing is their sound.
Great sound. Comfortable.
I have had these for quite some time now and they are A++. Amazing sound quality with noise cancelation and transparency mode. Great use of available app also. Would buy again
Great sound quality. The app is also great for setting up your personalized sound.
Grandson loves them, they do everything he wants, and are comfortable in his ears
I like the quality of sound. Super crisp.

Mise a jour après 5 mois le boitier de recharge pour les ecouteursQuand on  Recharge le boitier il ne recharge pas plus que 70% moi qui croyais que sennheiser était de la qualitée en plus j'ai 310$Il y a 3 ans j'ai payé 80$ pour une autre compagnie cette annee le boitier vient de mourir c'est rendu qu'il faut payer moins cher une chance que encore la garantie de sennheiser valideBonne paire d'ecouteurs jai toujours ete satisfait de sennheisersennheiser et bose seul Marques que j'achetes

One word,,,,,,,phenomenal buds.If you like audio, sounds will come at you and burst into your ears.Music you know will be transformed into sounding somehow,,,,,LIVE.Simply outrageously terrific headphones!

reviewTitle: Poor user experience for the money; ANC didn't work at all but it could be a one-off problem
reviewDescription: Very disappointing:- Sound quality was no better than a $40 pair of wired earbuds - unacceptable at $300+;- ANC didn't work at all. I tried tapping the earbuds & tried manually turning on in phone app;- Sound equalizer in the phone app didn't appear to work, or made no discernable difference;- Battery life was 1-2 hours tops, not the 6-8 hours advertised;- Case added no battery life to top up the earbuds.These problems could be a one-off affecting only my set, but that seems unlikely: earbuds run off an integrated circuit with all software in firmware, not run from separate modules (these things are incredibly compact when you consider all the functionality baked in). So I fail to see how basic sound functionality would work if advanced features don't.This is odd: I watched a ton of YouTube reviews comparing the Sennheiser True Wireless 3 with Sony's WF1000XM4 & Bose's Quiet Comfort earbuds; read reviews & comparisons in credible hi fi audio journals, credible IT product review sites, even a few news media (The Guardian, etc). Consensus was that the Sennheiser product is comparable to Sony's, ANC as good & audio performance if anything marginally better. None of them would have rated my pair that good.I leaned towards the Sennheiser earbuds as I've had such good experience with Sennheiser's Momentum 3 ANC headphones: audio quality is exceptional & ANC is nothing short of magical (esp. on a long flight). Plus I had to call Sennheiser to report the batteries failed 2 years in - technically right at the end of the warranty period (perhaps a bit over, in fact): they replaced the headsets without a quibble. That buys loyalty.I'm going to try Sony's WF1000XM4s instead now. This pair may have had a one-off problem, but they weren't that comfortable either (that's a personal issue - you need to try & find a pair that are comfortable. What works for me might not for you).I WILL however continue to default to Sennheiser for future audio gear. Those Momentum 3s & my warranty claim experience really did make an impression. This firm stands behind its products, they're easy to reach & very easy to deal with.BTW, I add Amazon's Asurion Extended Warranty protection to any high-value audio gear purchase. It's peace of mind, and Amazon's support is accessible & easy to deal with. Seems overkill, but $300 is an investment not an impulse buy & I can't afford to replace them soon.

reviewTitle: Good sound but web site connection issues
reviewDescription: These bud's are good sounding, but could not connect to Sennheiser web site to create personalized sound profile. After 4 times trying to contact help center finally got a ticket #[c231104-0309). Never heard from them again, no assistance whatsoever. After several wrong password warnings, I change my password, 5 times I tried this but web site still timed out when trying to connect. It seems strange that Sennheisers web site would tell me that I entered the wrong password when I did, but when correct password entered tell me I had to change password. Very frustrating......returned these buds but I did like their sound. With no personal sound configuration they were a no go.

So disappointed by this earbuds.Sound is amazing, anc is really good (except with wind).But so many little problems.Sometimes, right earbuds is not charging correctly, even after cleaning the case and the earbuds.Other times, I need to take them in and out of the case again to connect them.And the worst : how the **** did they broke after less than a year? For this price? Come on...Overpriced and not reliable. I love sennheiser for their headphones, but I will not buy their earbuds anymore, so disappointed.

Bought these for my wife and maybe I got a dud but the sound quality on voice calls was appalling. On top of the loud buzzing when she called, she sounded like she was miles from the microphone rendering them useless for all but essential calls. I guess they were defective so I returned them immediately
Sounds good but the buds don't fit well in ears. They slide around at the slightest movement (talking, walking, chewing, etc) and after a while fall off
Fit and feel is nice and so is the sound, but, cuts out a lot and not consistent in its performance

reviewTitle: Très bon produit, sauf pour la recharge et Bluetooth...
reviewDescription: Qualité sonore digne de Sennheiser est au rendez-vous, sauf pour ces 2 problèmes. #1-L'étui de recharge ne détecte pas les écouteurs donc impossible de les recharger, sauf si on s'acharne/s'entête. Un moment donné l'étui se réveille pour les recharger sans être capable de l'expliquer (je pense que ma technique voodoo fonctionne !). #2-Les écouteurs ne sont pas détectés par les appareils (iPhone, portable HP, Microsoft Surface), surtout utilisé avec Teams. J'ai dû les re-synchroniser une dizaine de fois avant d'abdiquer au bout d'une semaine. Je les ai retournés et j'ai acheté des AirPods Pro qui fonctionnent sans problème !

Le Sennheiser True wireless 3 a présenté de gros problèmes de pairages et j'ai dû remettre les paramètres à ceux d'usine. Le son est correct sans plus et pas meilleur que les Apple Air Pod Pro.  Les Air Pod Pro enclenchent immédiatement et tiennent farouchement la correction.  Les Sennheiser surtout le canal gauche avait tendance à grésiller non pas à cause du volume modéré mais dû à un signal Bluetooth qui n'était pas optimal.  Quelle déception car j'avais lu beaucoup de bien de ces écouteurs. Côté tenue dans les oreilles, ils semblent tenir plus fermement que les Apples. J'ai des Sennheiser Momentum in ear filaires qui sont magnifiques.

reviewTitle: Two pairs ...... two fails ...... four months.
reviewDescription: Unfortunately my experience has not been a good one. After one month the L earbud failed on the first pair. Amazon replaced without drama. The replacement pair has failed within three months; this time very low volume from the R earbud. As the return date has passed Amazon will not act and I have to pay to return them to Sennheiser!I'm changing back to Bose.
Loved these at first. However, I cannot use them anymore. There is a terrible noise coming from them when in use, enough to drive one crazy!

reviewTitle: Great sound, the rest is sub-par garbage for that price
reviewDescription: I'll preface this by saying that I had some Sennheiser CXT400 (The 100$ ish entry ones) and they broke within 6 months. I contacted Sennheiser for the warranty and it took them 2-3 months to answer me (Said they lost track of the demand) but they upgraded my warranty by sending me some True Wireless Momentum 2. Those TW2 lasted me a year, they were good with almost no issues, some small problems that weren't a deal break up. But the fact that I had two Sennheiser product break on me within such a short time had me worried about the build quality in general of the company... So I reluctantly decided to buy these TW3 cause the sound of the TW2 is amazing and it's technically an upgrade right? They will iron out the kinks and make it better?...Oh boy, was I wrong... The TW3 are 1 step forward and 2 steps back:+ Stability fins+ Sound is amazing+ Wireless charging on the case+/- Charging port is in front of the case. Not a big deal but really annoying since the TW2 one is at the back and it make sense+/- Case has no button to check the charge level. You need to open the case itself- Not sure if a defect on mine but the earbuds sometimes won't charge... Yep, that's a deal breaker for me. Might be cause it's badly seated or the connection is poor.- Anytime I change song, the sound cuts off for half a second. So I tested it out and basically, anything that get in front of the earbuds make it cutoff (finger, hand, moving my head fast, even taking off my shirt...)- The ANC is not good, especially when the TW2 one was amazing...- The "Power On" and "Recharge Headset" voice is extremely loud at times and sometime it's low. I don't understand that one and there's no way to change it in the app- The case doesn't have a button to check the battery levelI am beyond disappointed at that price range. If you want a premium earbud, I suggest you shop around cause the TW3 are subpar on everything but the sound

Update after +4 months of using them on a daily basis:(I should mention that I take good care of my buds and problems mentioned below are not a result of mishandling them)About 2 weeks ago when I was on a call, one of the earbuds started making a beeping sound. It was annoying but I thought it was a one time thing. That was just the beginning.  Over the past 2 weeks the earbuds have just gone crazy. Now they make beeping sounds every now and then (out of nowhere), sometimes for 10s sometimes just 1s. It only happens when the ANC is on, and the ANC doesn't work as well as it used to. It doesn't filter out the noise like it used to, and sometimes it actually amplifies some weird frequencies (I hear very odd things). The beeping/clicking sound from the left earbud has become a normal problem. The sound from the right earbud is sometimes muffled and outside noise is amplified instead. I can no longer listen to music with the ANC on. I have searched online forums and apparently THIS IS A KNOWN ISSUE for these earbuds. Some people have fixed the issue (temporarily) by cleaning the buds, which I have done multiple times, but didn't help. Factory resetting them didn't help either. I am going to try and return these buds (probably not gonna make it) because I am fully disappointed in them. I was not expecting these issues from a +300$ pair of buds._____________Old review:Got these for my IPhone 14 pro about 2 months ago. Waited to write this review to be able to paint a true picture. Starting with:+ The positives: great music quality, will not disappoint for a pair of in-ear buds. Great build quality, the case and the buds are very sturdy, the magnets hold on to the buds for deal life and never let go, haven't had problems with the size of the earbuds so far and the fit pretty good in my ears (had to replace the one for my left ear with a larger size though). Have been wearing them during workouts, studying, working etc,. I am pleased with the noise cancelling, It's not perfect but is does what it's supposed to. Touch controls are sensitive enough and over all my experience with these buds have been really good. There is are some drawbacks though that I should mention. Before that, I should mention I have updated these buds/all my devices to the latest version.- The negative:Based on my experience with these pair of earbuds, with an IPhone 14 pro, a gaming laptop (Windows 11) and a Linux (Ubuntu 22), there are some connection issues. Throughout the last ~60 days, there have been more than 10 times when I had to take the buds out and put in my ear, hear ''connected" and play audio just to realize it's not playing. Putting the buds back into their case and redoing the process has worked every time. They have multi-point connectivity, meaning you can connect to 2 devices at the same time. But my experience with this has been far from seamless. Sometimes I'm listening to sth on my phone, and the music suddenly stops for no reason. And more importantly, any signal from the pc overrides the current stream from the phone, meaning the music stops if I get an email notification on my pc. Muting the pc doesn't help either. There have been more than 10 times where I had to put the buds back in their case and take them out just to connect to to 2 devices because it didn't connect to the 2nd device. Now I only connect to both devices if most of my work is on the pc.One last issue with these is that, whenever I send a voice/video message, I hear "call ended" at the end of it. This is quite bothersome for me because I tend to send lots of voice messages, but I have to hear the lady say "call ended" at the end of any kind of voice recording.

reviewTitle: The worst earphones I have ever used.
reviewDescription: I want to start off by saying that I never write reviews but this product is so bad that I felt the need to warn any consumer to not purchase these.The good thing: The sound quality is good.The bad things: The moment you touch one of the earphones they pause or hang up on a call. They are re-mappable however this feature is the only feature you can’t remap which is highly irritating.They constantly disconnect from Bluetooth and if you ever need to switch devices you have to go onto your device and manually disconnect it instead of going on the other device to pair.Do not buy these earphones, they are complete trash.

My right earbud won't charge. This issue started after 2 months of using the MTW3 earbuds. The earbuds also stopped disconnecting properly - they will continue playing even when in the case which is problematic because sometimes the case starts humming.Amazon have been horribly unhelpful. They told me that despite the fact they sold me a $300+ for a product that stopped working after a few weeks, it is "out of their hands". They told me to contact Sennheiser, and gave me the phone number of a porn hotline, which was incredibly disrespectful. I then researched what the real number was but Sennheiser has been sold to some other company and it is impossible to get ahold of a representative.Honestly, this is the worst customer service from Amazon and Sennheiser. These earbuds are a genuine scam and i feel robbed by Amazon.

for the price, these are the worst earphones I have ever bought. After a year, this product stops charging completely (both case and earbuds) and will not connect to your phone despite countless factory reset attempts. I thought this was a one off problem until I googled the issue and found countless Reddit forums of people saying the same thing. If you purchase these, you will be constantly disappointed and frustrated a year into use. Contacting customer service is also a pain as it can take a while to get a hold of someone. I was better off buying Sony earbuds instead.

reviewTitle: Sound issues developed 5 weeks into using earbuds
reviewDescription: As much as I was satisfied with a quality of the sound for the first month, the issue started developing between 4-5 weeks after using the headphones (which is, inconveniently-enough, right after a month-long return policy ended), where the right earbud became much quieter than the left one (even the touch-pad’s sounds that you hear when adjusting the volume are barely heard).Turning on Noise cancellation is even worse, where every 1-2 seconds the volume would be auto-adjusting up and down by itself).Now, another 2 weeks passed since then and my left earbud has the exact same issues. The highest volume setting is now about 40-60% of what it used to be originally; manual and factory resets via their native earbuds app didn’t help at all. They were never mis-handled, dropped, nor damaged in any way - I’ve kept them in a mint condition, and the issues still occurred.Not worth their higher-end price since after reading some feedback online, this can be a common issue with this model with no resolution other then going through a warranty ordeal.

reviewTitle: Fantastic product but charging is an issue
reviewDescription: These earbuds are one of the best pairs I've owned. They have great sound and noise cancellation. The controls are customizable, and the microphone works well, even on busy streets. They're comfortable and well-built. But I'm giving them a 1-star rating because of the charging issue. Often, one earbud is completely dead. I've the tried cleaning contact points, making sure the earbuds are 'clicked' in etc., but the problem keeps happening. It's a hit or miss with charging, and I can't rely on them. I never know when I'll get a low battery notification.
Bought in April 2023.  Battery will not charge past 60%.  Then drains down to 10% after half day without me using the headphones.  I bought 6  sennheiser earbuds but this is the worst experience.

reviewTitle: One star because broke in 2 weeks and because of a non-existing noise cancellation
reviewDescription: Returning because left earbud started playing at lower volume than the right one and nothing can fix it.Noise cancellation is non-existing. Nice bass for listening death metal, but doesn't make that much difference overall.If you're audiophile, get an over the head headset.If you're looking for noise cancellation BUDS, sony wf-1000xm does a much better job (pretty much the only buds that can "turn on silence") , otherwise, go with over the head headset.Also, if you have big ears like me, those are not very comfortable to wear. The earbud tip is floppy, so it doesn't keep the earbud very stable in your ear. I found myself constantly readjusting the earbud because they're just too small for my ears. My ears are not even massive. Look proportionate on my head)This ones are just "normal expensive earbuds". For me personally, not worth the price.Sound more or less the same as sony's.Noise cancellation non-existing.Too small for my ears.Higher price than the sony's.

reviewTitle: Won't charge or hold a charge if they actually do
reviewDescription: Maybe good sound, but absolutely terrible at charging and holding a charge.

I was on a longgggg search for earbuds ever since my power Beats Pro broke down (btw if you’re ever considering buying those, DO NOT BUY THEM, because they break down eventually and their batteries die after an hour of use even though it shows as 55%, and apparently it is a COMMON ISSUE for power Beats Pro users-some of them are suing Apple for it) and due to reason I mentioned above, I did not want to buy AirPods Pro, even though I have their entire Apple ecosystem, but one thing those beats had was a seamless switch between devices (a function I didn’t know I needed until I had it). Those beats were able to switch from my laptop to my phone immediately when I pick up my phone to scroll on Instagram, and switch back to my laptop when I resume video watching on my laptop. Maybe a little extra, but I thought it was quite useful, so when I was looking at earbuds in this price range, I found SENNHEISER Momentum TW 3, the only one that supports Bluetooth multipoint connectivity. At first listen, the sound quality was great. I like hip-hop more, so I immediately noticed the bass enhance. However, I also enjoy EDM occasionally, and one of the songs I listened to, I think the treble squeaked a little bit, but could just be the song. ANC is good, but not as good as AirPods Pro? When I had AirPods Pro in, i could not hear the person standing right next to me, even without music. However, with Sennheiser, I find that without music or sound playing, a little bit of background noise still comes thru and if somebody is talking right next to me, I can hear it. Good for conversations, bad for studying. Transparency mode was good, although I think there was a bit white noise in the background, not sure if that is just surroundings or the earbuds. Controls are sensitive, since they are touch to control. I don’t like them, because I hate having to press down on it, but it was very sensitive - if you’re trying to take them off or put them on you will trigger the controls. What really made the dealbreaker for me was the fit. For some reason, maybe because my ears are of different size, it fit my right ear comfortably and nicely, but refuse to fit my left ear. I’ve tried every wing and every tip, they just won’t fit. The design of these earbuds goes like this: the body of the earbud is supposed to fit entirely in your ear, while the tip goes in your ear canal. This brings an issue: there are cartilages in ears and everyone has different ears, so I’m not sure how they expected the body to fit the shape of of everyone’s cartilages..after an hour or so of fidgeting with the tips and wings, and an hour or so of listening, I could feel the pressure of earbud on my left ear canal and was not happyTLDR: great sound quality, ANC good but obv not top of the game (if you want top of the game, BOSE QC 2 is your best bet), fit not very comfortable for my left ear (could just be me)Update: since it’s uncomfortable in my left ear, I can’t go long without adjusting it, and every time I adjust the headphones it triggers the controls (since they are super sensitive) and it’s kinda annoying

reviewTitle: ANC anecdotique, qualité du son perfectible
reviewDescription: J’ai utilisé ces écouteurs pendant 4 mois et les ai remplacéLes principaux points forts sont, selon moi: le look (étui et écouteurs bien finis avec sensation de qualité au touché), l’autonomie très correcte et la connexion BT multi-points.Parmi les points négatifs:1) L’ANC complètement raté. Dans un bus par exemple, les écouteurs ne sont pas capables de filtrer correctement les graves et il y a un traitement qui sur-amplifie certains sons; ce qui nuie beaucoup au confort d’écoute. Clairement, si vous cherchez des écouteurs avec réduction de bruits, passez votre chemin.2) Les aigus peinent à être reproduits correctement, plus particulièrement les voix. Écouter un podcast avec ces écouteurs donne l’impression de revenir à la radio des années 80. Il y a également un mode « podcast » dans l’application qui vous fera reculer encore 10 ans en arrière. Par contre, les basses sont très présentes. Les médiums sont corrects.3) La fonction téléphone main-libre est inutilisable. En extérieur, les micros ne parviennent pas à différencier la voix des sons ambiants. A chaque fois, je devais raccrocher, ranger les écouteurs dans leur étui et rappeler mon interlocuteur.4) Les fonctions tactiles à désactiver tout de suite. Qui a bien pu se dire que mettre des fonctions tactiles sur ses écouteur-boutons serait une bonne idée ? Exemple pratique: en conversation, vous voulez repositionner un écouteur dans votre oreille, ce qui mettra fin à l’appel. Se passer la man dans les cheveux ou enfiler une capuche? Même chose. Côté Apple, les fonctions marchent à la pression, pas au toucher… Très irritant selon moi, un vrai problème de conception.5) L’application iPhone: pour utiliser les écouteurs, il faut obligatoirement ouvrir l’application pour les connecter au téléphone. On perd en spontanéité d’utilisation.

reviewTitle: Plenty to love if don't have a fram of reference. But expected better given their hype
reviewDescription: I was looking for replacement for my Jabra 65t active, which are good, but don't have noise cancelling. I had previously tried the Sony 1000XM4, but had felt they didn't have a secure fit. I read great reviews of the Momentum 3. Well with the Sony I could definitely notice a better sound compared to the Jabra 65t and the noise cancelling worked great. Despite glowing reviews saying these have the best sound, the Momentum 3 was not consistently better than my old Jabra 65t. Some songs were, but not all. Movies also not any better. When working out with small tip sizes and wings, the noise was not isolated well, and noise cancelling didn't work. With bigger tips or wings, ears became sore. They also were eve less secure than the Sony where working out. I felt them bouncing around which caused irritation and some some sound distortion. When I was changing from one headphone to another for comparison, I noticed that sometimes it would connect to my phone and ply music when they were in the case. Though it appears to have good controls, it took some digging to get it to use google rather than Bixby. When you tap to turn on noise cancelling or ambient, it doesn't tell you that the setting has been changed.

reviewTitle: Tested 3 high-end earbuds; kept the Sony
reviewDescription: I bought three pairs of mid to high-end earbuds to test extensively.I kept the Sony WF-1000XM3 (CAD224,  previously owned, very good condition). They had noticeably better ANC and bass.The Soundcore Liberty 3 (CAD120ish) would have been my second choice as it was unbelievably inexpensive when on sale on amazon.ca, and was amazingly customizable. It would be a great intro to mid/higher-end earbuds, or a second set to your high-ends, if you're made of money. I also think they'd be a great choice for a youngster.As for these Sennheisers, they sounded quite good, but, to my ears, slightly exaggerated the treble, and bass was a little thin. I thought the fabric case was pretty, but would surely be a magnet for grease, and that's likely wouldn't be fully cleanable.

Be aware that packages seem to be open/pre-owned. Ordered these as a gift, and upon opening, bf found that all 4 sizes of tips for fitting in the ears were missing.Thankfully bf had other tips from his old headphones, and he likes the sound quality/comfort of the earbuds. Good headphones, carry the seinheiser reputation well.

reviewTitle: Best in Sound, Worst in Software
reviewDescription: If sound is your number one priority, this is pretty much your only option.  The battery and comfort are all good.  But you need to put up with extremely unstable connection + extremely sluggish app + much-maligned firmware update.  All the shortcomings of this earbuds are at the software level. Honestly if Sennheiser is willing to fire those trash programmers they have now and hire some solid ones who really know what they are doing, this buds could easily be the best true wireless.

reviewTitle: Only good if you plan to use both.
reviewDescription: These excell at stereo imaging over the competition. Imho that's where they shine. With both in they will sound as good as some headphones do.However if you plan to use just one, look somewhere else, these are not worth the money for that approach, competition sounds better at lower price ranges, especially if you want literally any bass.

reviewTitle: Excellent sound quality, mediocre noise cancelling and terrible fit
reviewDescription: I want to love these so much. The sound is really good, for the 45 seconds you get a proper seal. I have no idea what the size of the test group was for these but it must have been absolutely tiny and not diverse at all.The noise cancelling exists, but it's not comparable to their Sony rival, or my galaxy buds pros.The touch sensitivity is by far the best of all the wireless buds I've tried, but the app is just terrible. In the end, these are a very expensive pike of meh. I really did try to love them.
Overall these headphones suck
Disappointed with the new Sennheiser Momentum TW3. Sound quality is not even par with TW2.Noise cancelling is not optimal (TW2 far better). Returning this.

These are the by far some of the best TWS I have in my growing collection. Superior sound quality and thanks to a recent Smart Control update, superior tuning capabilities. My only gripe is the fit in my ears. These come with a 3 set of wings as well as the standard ear tips but they just feel awkward. Not uncomfortable or painful but it feels as though I can never get them to seat properly in my ears. Like I said it's not a problem with short listening sessions or painful fatigue.

Not my fist Sennheiser buds, but these are by far the best (so far).Can't believe how far noise cancelling has come - Thumbs up for sure.The last buds i owned were made by Sony, these blow the baseline away.

Son audio tres bon je dirais une douceur,j'ai des sony wf-1000xm4 et des technics eah-ez60.bon pour la reductions de bruit les sennheiser sont clairement en retrait par rapport au sony et meme plus bas que les technics sony sont les roi.malgrer tout les sony sont ceux qui je trouve ont un meilleur son pour ce qui est des basse et le port des bourgeons de ces derniers ne conviennent pas a tout les oreils les sennheiser sont mieux mais aucun doute pour moi entre les 3 ceux qui equilibre le mieux le port/maintient et son,ce sont les technis quoicque un peu capricieux et que les charniere de la boite de chargement des technics semblent devenir lousse avec le temps mais si je devais decider entre les 3 j'opterais technis a coup sur pour l'ensemble....si votre budget le permet miin il y a les sound peats sonic version 1 qui n'ont pas d'isolation active mais passive et vraiment le son pour ce prix est vraiment bon la version deux iks ont rajouter plus de basse et je ne le regrette pas car dans la version du son la v.1 est a l'idéal de mon gout perso.bref beaucoup de details si cela peut en eclairer quelques uns.mais dans tout cas ils sont de bon a tres bon mais j ai vraiment un faible pour les technics surtout pour le "punchy de l'ensemble du son.pour vulgariser

I really like these, but docking them a point for not being able to customize the call touch controls.You can customize everything else, but if you touch your ear bud during a call, it hangs up. You can't fix them in your ear, or add your second one in. You will hang up

i use HD 599s on the daily. These momentum 3s are phenomenal. The noise cancelling is pretty good, but for me the audio quality is unreal. I love the transparency feature too.Only problem is that mine have started to act up. Support seems good, they still want me to pay for shipping one way to send them the units for repair, understandably.

reviewTitle: Bien mais cela pourrait être mieux
reviewDescription: Le son est bon. Le contrôle du volume facile. Mais le pairing si vous avez deux appareils comme un iPhone et un iPad il y a confusion. Les choses se compliquent. Je m’attendais à ce prix à mieux. Puis un meilleur ipx que 4.

reviewTitle: Charging issues -well known by others as well
reviewDescription: There is apparently a well known issue with the buds not charging. It is known by Sennheiser,  because they have posted corrective measures, that have not worked with mine.But!!!  When they work, they are top of rhe line for sound! Over Bose, Beats, Mifo (Fiitii, 05+ &07) all of which I've bought and used over the last 3yrs. Sennheiser takes 1st place here, for sound quality. %100.So let's fix the charging issue!

reviewTitle: Right side ear piece has died within one year
reviewDescription: The sound is great, the ease of accepting calls while listening to music worked fluently.  I had a couple days where they died early. Now the right side ear bud will not accept a charge. It is dead.  I contacted Sennheiser support and they responded within a day. They sent me a return authorization for repair or replacement.
Usable, sound quality is great. But software is clunky and doesn't feel modern or high tech which they should for the price. Beats studio buds+ are better for the money
The sound quality of these is by far the best on the market but,  only if you hve the right ear pieces that fit your ear.  I feel they are one size off either too big or too small.

reviewTitle: Best earbuds overall with connectivity issues
reviewDescription: I've personally owned tws from Jabra, Samsung, Jaybird and a bunch of cheaper ones. Sony and Senn are probably the only exceptions.Overall these are the best of any buds I've owned and used. In terms of build quality, sound, comfort and noise cancellation hands down. I've already used these on almost a daily basis since buying them a few months ago.They don't fall out because of the non-intrusive wings, and are comfortable enough to wear for extended periods of time (4 hours or more). I use buds all the time at home and at work to help me focus and enjoy audiobooks and podcasts.Background white noise is present but it's very minimal and only noticeable when nothing is playing and everything is quiet.The thing that drives me crazy is how poor the setup is, which is part of their design. Buds need to be in the case with lid open to pair so keep it nearby if you switch sources often.There are persistent connectivity issues and a bud might not work until you unpair and pair the device again. Frustrating but the positives out weigh this random inconvenience for me.One of the few electronic devices I've bought that I feel provide an experience worthy of the price. Hope future updates continue to improve the minor issues I've experienced.

Colour Name: Triple BlackSize





: One Size

reviewDescription: I like the headphones. They have great sound, good bass (adjustable in the app), and the noise cancelling is fantastic. Vey comfortable, and with the tips and rings, very adjustable, which is ideal if you use them to hike, jog, bike...whatever, for this price you don't want them to fall out while in use.But.... someone else mentioned this, so I know I'm not the only one who sees this as an issue. Getting these out of the case is far more complicated than it needs to be. I'm shocked with all the technology that went into these, and all the design that went into the ergonomics of the fit, that they left the case and storage like this. Seriously I would have thought someone would have raised a flag during the product testing that this is a poor design. Everything else is top notch, but you shouldn't need 2 hands and a flashlight to get the damn things out of the case without dropping the case or only getting one out, t and trying to get the other one out before the single one pairs on its own... and if it does, you have to put the one back in the case and try the whole thing over again. Incredibly frustrating.

reviewTitle: Je les utilise dans un garage pour la suppression de bruit.
reviewDescription: La sonorité est fantastique. La suppression de bruit n'est pas adapté a un atelier de mécanique automobile. Ce n'est pas un défaut et cela ne m'empêche pas de les porter comme protection auditive au travail. C'est ce que j'ai trouvé de mieux. Les bruits constants de ventilation, moteur et autres sont très bien coupés. Mais les bruits d'impact et d'air comprimé sont moins bien contrôlés et demeure présent, même agaçant. C'est beaucoup moins chaud que les coquilles (3M Bluetooth) que je porte a l'occasion quand c'est nécessaire. Je les ramène à la maison le soir pour profiter de leurs qualité dans un environnement plus conviviale.
variant:
Colour Name: Triple BlackSize





: One Size

reviewDescription: PROS- Audio quality is impeccable with crystal clear highs as well as rich and deep sounding mids and bass that are very present in the music. TAKE THE TIME TO FIND THE RIGHT FIT FOR YOUR EARS.- Noise Cancelling is amazing as always with Bose, particularly the AWARE mode. It controls and perfectly fluctuates the strength of the noise cancellation depending on how loud the areas are that you’re in so that you can still hear people speaking to you over all the racket in your environment. Also, if the room you’re in is quiet and something loud and abrupt we’re to happen there’s a feature that will quickly dull that sound before the whole thing travels to your ears.- These buds are super lightweight so I can wear them for hours and forget they’re in my ears while I perform tasks; this is also because I took the time to choose the RIGHT FIT FOR MY EARS. And the reason why I emphasize this is because all of the features just work best with the proper fit.CONS - They’re still fairly buggy when trying to maintain connection with the Bose Connect app and need an extra software update or two which will come. Also, sometimes if you move or something moves enough to slightly alter the orientation of the buds in your ear, the music sometimes does this thing where it sounds different for a split second, as if it’s changing in and out of a stereo mode or something. I suspect this also has something to do with not wearing the proper fit and letting them become too greasy and slippery in my ears. I now use micellar water pads to gently clean wax and oils. I have since experienced this much less and don’t notice this issue anymore.

reviewTitle: Sound is awesome but... a few nagging issues.
reviewDescription: I would have given this a five-star review based on the sound quality, but it lacks in a few areas.First issue, it doesn't fit my left ear as well as it fits my right ear, and that's a problem, because it doesn't always seal properly in my left ear. No two ear canals left to right are exactly the same and this device is very unforgiving in terms of fitment.I can get it to fit by playing around with it but if I move, it moves and usually pops out somewhat, breaking the seal and you lose a lot of tonality and bass.Second issue, is the low battery life. The competitively priced Sony's have far superior battery life, just not as good in terms of audio quality, but that's subjective. I like the Bose, because of their fantastic bass, and they have a little bit more volume than the Sony's which I find lacking in some cases.In any case they're far better than the first generation, and I'm keeping these. I guess in short, they're fantastic if you don't planning on moving much when you're listening...

reviewDescription: Sound quality and NC  is exceptional. Have had this earbud for several months now. Only issue is that the bluetooth connection disconnects in high-traffic hot spots in the downtown area. Doesn't always happen, but happens more often than it should. I've found the solution is to tap once to pause music, wait a few seconds and tap again to get it going again. An inconvenient glitch, but the buds are still worth it because of the unrivaled sound quality. Hope the people at Bose can roll out a fix soon. This is the only reason I've given it 4 stars and not 5.

reviewTitle: Won't connect to any desktop or laptop I own
reviewDescription: Bose is a sound system company and not a software company. Their product is excellent on the fundamentals: sound, noise cancelling, fit, etc. However - if I can't get any of my computers to connect to them, what does it matter? So far, the earbuds only work on my cell phone but I bought them for my work: and I can't use them for that. The reason we like Bluetooth products is because the Bluetooth protocol is supposed to make things universally compatible. It appears Bose prefers such things to remain mediated by a proprietary software package that - if your company has an IT security section - you can't install on your work computer. I can't even get them to work on my home computer. I am too lazy to ask for a refund so these will gather dust until I have some reason to use them with my phone, I guess.

reviewTitle: Connectivity problems after 2 weeks, failure after 32 days
reviewDescription: After about 2 weeks, struggled to connect to my computer or phone consistently and struggled to get noise cancellation to work consistently.  On day 32, totally failed to activate noise cancellation or connect to any devices.  Forums talk about this as a consistent problem with these earbuds, which I didn't find out about until after buying.  Hard reset temporarily fixed the issue, but I don't want earbuds this expensive to fail to connect, fail to noise cancel and require a factory reset to work properly after 1 month of light use.  Would suggest that if you buy and have similar issues, arrange a return before the 30 day period expires.

reviewTitle: Catastrophically frustrating but excellent when they work, would not buy again
reviewDescription: So, the Apple headphones won't fit in your ears? So you're looking for an alternative, so you think "Oh, Bose does good products! I'll try them."I mean, if it's your only option.Bose please find whatever executive said these things should have touch controls instead of tactile buttons and fire him so hard he can only get a job in the mailroom back in time in the 70s.Do you want touch controls that barely function? Touch controls hat can't tell the difference between swipe, press, medium press, and long press? Do you want noise cancellation that just... doesn't turn on 20% of the time? (Yes, even if I long press to Aware mode it sounds exactly the same as Quiet, meaning it's not working, like right now while I am writing this). Do you want headphones that can't be found by Bose's own headphone management DRM app? Because the Bose app on my iPad can't find these suckers.When they work, the sound is great, the cancellation is stellar, and the fit is snug. But given that about 30-40% of the time I interact with them they are frustrating, don't work as expected, or just baffling, they really aren't a great outing.An alternative to Apple that is more expensive and less reliable. Put buttons on it and fix your app.Would not buy again, regret buying. 1 star because they are headphones, 1 star because noise cancellation works most of the time and the battery is alright. Would give 0.5 stars for snug fit but Amazon doesn't allow it.

reviewDescription: I'm currently waiting for a second replacement pair (since purchasing the original set about 4 months ago). Expecting about a month for the turn around and new set (which, rightly so will be covered free of charge).These are not cheap earbuds. When fully functioning I'd consider them a 4/5 value. Personally I found the fit difficult to get right and even then they do occasionally fall out when I'm active. If you're looking for a set to carry you primarily through workouts you may want to look elsewhere.The biggest issues I've had are with hardware issues. The earbuds are tied to the docking station so if that goes, so do they. My first pair had a bent charging prong so one bud would no longer be functional.Second set ended up having a faulty earbud that would only get 10% volume.Disappointing considering the cost. I'm hoping the next set lasts a bit longer. I would not purchase these again but would likely try a Bose set of over the ear headphones.

reviewDescription: When my Sony MF-1000MX4's left earbud died, i read the numerous raving reviews for these earbuds... "best ANC!!" etc etc.While the ANC is great, it might be too good or too over correcting. When I'm sitting in my Office at work (Next to the DC, constant AC noise and other generic office noises) or at home (live next to a busy road, live with 3 other people) and I have these buds in and configured for any of the ANC settings there a is very audible and music distorting (at low volume 5% or medium 15+%) white noise.The best description of this white noise, is if you've ever lived near to a major highway and the sound of the window/traffic in the distance that... subtle wooooshing sound.. or if you've ever enabled monitoring on your microphone and the gain is turned all the way up and you hear the similar wooshing sound.The white noise is very intrusive to low volume speech or music and is still audible even at louder volumes.If you have good hearing or sensitive hearing i cannot recommend these at all.

reviewTitle: Amazing product ruined by software and connectivity
reviewDescription: First off I will start out by saying these headphones have amazing sound and the best ANC in the business. If this review was solely for those two things these headphones would get 5 stars.Now for the bad. 1) Hissing white noise when in Transparency Mode. I do not know why but this issue persisted even after exchanging them.2) Left bud connectivity issues all the time. I had the newest firmware updated and while the left bud can be used on it own, it constantly disconnects forcing me to put both buds back in the case and restart.3) Comfort. I personally found these not to work with my ears. I cannot find a better fitting earbud than the AirPods Pro’s. This is what I found for myself and fit will vary.I won’t even mention the terrible Bose app. Overall these few issues could be overlooked if not for the $379 sticker price. You cannot ask more than AirPods Pro 2s and have issues like the ones above.

Colour Name: Midnight BlueSize





: One Size

reviewDescription: I'm actually disappointed in these earbuds but that said, it's the best I could find. The price is too high but the size is ok and the sound quality is good along with ok mics for phonecalls. I've had to buy aftermarket foam tips for them to stay in my ears for any longer than 10 minutes. The wings don't stay on very well either but do help some to keep the buds from moving. Beefier wings would be preferable as well as foam tips for a better ear canal fit.The Bluetooth connection with my 2 year old phone has been a hit or miss. Sometimes, roughly once/week I hear a loud pop in my ears and the buds reboot. Afterwards they often don't reconnect to my phone and I have to put them back in the case to reset them.The volume seems to have a life of its own too. Despite putting the volume on my phone up to max it's barely noticeable in the buds. Then I have to open the Bose app and adjust the volume in there to get it back to where it should be.They lack shortcuts or customizable shortcuts that many other buds have but they work most of the time. It happens that they don't react at all when I try to answer a phonecall and I'm forced to pull out the phone to answer. I can still talk through the buds but the buttons are unresponsive. I've missed several calls because of this.Battery life is ok. They last me almost 7 hours and since they updated the firmware I can use one bud while the other is charging to extend it to the whole work day.The one thing that bugs me the most has to do with noise cancelling. There is no way to turn off noise cancelling completely. This means that even when you are using them in transparency mode, they will still cancel some sounds that they deem too loud: such as closing a car door or driving over a bump in the road or even taking to someone. Wind noise is also something it is happy to cancel out, however it's not very effective at that.If I'm using them in the car while listening to the radio on normal volume, they will limit the volume in my ears in a pretty rudementary and uncomfortable way. Not what you'd expect for almost C$400. Definitely need a way to turn this off and adjust the levels of it.So to sum it up, they're the best I could find, and I've tried lots of them, but for $375 I expect way more.
