Wireless charge works fine.I have tried and own many wireless earbuds from various manufacturers and I can say this is the first time I legit hate a pair of buds. Avoid these.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 31, 2023
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the 1MORE EVO earbuds with high expectations. However, I must say I'm disappointed. The right earbud is clearly defective, as its battery drains much faster than the left earbud. It dropped to zero percent while the left earbud still had 80 percent battery after approximately 110 minutes (tested three times with music playing, no ANC, and LDAC off). I've tried charging them fully, but the problem persists.I have lost confidence in 1MORE, as I have bought three earbuds from them. The first one only lasted one year, the second one couldn't charge or pair, and now the third one, which is the 1MORE EVO, has this battery issue. I'll be returning them to Amazon for a refund.

reviewTitle: Placed order brand new and got 2nd hand
reviewDescription: The photos are too obvious. Even the right ear bud almost no sound with maximum volume.
Ils sont excellents mais le droit ne fonctionne déjà plus (et ils n'ont pris aucun choc)

reviewTitle: Falla en 6 meses, no lo recomiendo.
reviewDescription: El producto en si es tal cual se describe, bonito, con calidad de materiales, con calidad de sonido, pero en 6 meses el auricular derecho solo dura cargado 20 minutos. He enviado mensajes al servicio de atención al cliente de 1MORE y no recibo ninguna respuesta.Al menos Amazon me ha respondido, devuelvo el producto y me abonan el dinero.

reviewTitle: Great sound for a very small package
reviewDescription: (take it with a grain of salt)(Tried with an iPhone it works fine with all its features) (Review is subject to change as updates rolls in)May 20: I have been having issues with the earphones cutting out randomly when using LDAC (in adaptive mode), a distance from my head to my pocket shouldn't really cause any issues and I know this is not due to interference because I have been in a park for 6 hours and it would cut out still, not to mention that I also did an audiophile session where I just sat on a chair and listened to my favourite tracks while the phones is on the table next to me so range is also not an issue I believe. This issue should be fixed as soon as they can.A gust of wind is very audible through ANC and Transparent mode.ANC: It could be better, I would say Apple's ANC is a bit better but this isn't that far behind in my opinion. Transparency mode sound a bit muffled and could definitely sound better, I don't know if software could fix it.Update May18: After a whole day of real world test it definitely isn't bad and is better than an earpod in some circumstances, with an earpod it tends to muffle everything around while the evo makes your world sounds like it doesn't have any low frequency but it blocks machine noises with ease.Sound Quality: Is very good especially with LDAC I can't speak of the dynamics of it because everybody has different ears and this product tries to cater to the best of its ability, I just really hope soon we will have a way to EQ the earphones to your liking, SoundID is good but the demo songs they provided makes it difficult to tune it. The out of the box EQ is terrible I recommend setting up SoundID as soon you set it up.There are times it sounds fine on the demo music but once you listen to the songs you usually listen to it may overshoot the bass or high frequencies and could sound very harsh, you definitely have to spend some time with it.Without using SoundID the default tune sounds dead and tight with pretty harsh mids, SoundID helps with the stereo separation as well making it sound wider.Build quality: The charging case is great, it is made out of metal and rubbered below, something to consider though is the case does get cold for being metal. Having keys in your pocket with the case doesn't scratch it that easily which is a surprise after a whole day of work.The earphones itself is plastic but it doesn't feel cheap and styling looks great at least to me with the round copper accent on it.Controls: This one is pretty weird, it's double tap to pause/play, hold to change ANC and tripple tap for your assistant.Single tap does nothing at the moment it can probably be added through software update, for now I have no way to change the song through the earphone's controls without sacrificing other functions.Features: This earphone is integrated to the Android eco-system pretty nicely, when you first pair it a little window would come up from your phone like an earpod connecting to an iPhone, find my earphone also works on this and gets connected to your google account.It pauses the music when you take one off works fine and latency isn't too bad either.Comfort: I have had no fatigue while testing this for 3hrs and it is not bulky, looks good on your ears as well.Update May18: After a whole day of testing, I have not have any discomfort while working the whole day. Passive noise cancellation is good as well, good to note as well that the tips are oval and not round.Battery: Pretty good for 3hrs coming from 100% you're left with 70-80% at around 80-100% volume ANC OFFSomething to add is that the app is pretty limited and basic at the moment and has a 2.3 star review, hopefully they could sort that out in the upcoming months because the product they're producing are really good.Summary:Pros:Great Sound (LDAC)Great pair with the Android eco-systemGood featuresGreat build qualityUnboxing looks very professionalUSB CGood battery lifeCons:Software side is basicControls needs an updateANC could use some tweakingLack of EQ controlMore eartip options would be nice.

reviewTitle: A good all around earbuds that need some EQ tweaking to impress
reviewDescription: 1more is known to offer good headphones/earphones for the price and this one follows this trend.I bought it at 169$ CAD which I think makes it a good buy. From the unboxing experience to the sound quality and features, it can compete with 250$+ TWS earbuds.The earbuds feels nice and solid. They are made out of plastic which makes them light and doesn't feel hollow or cheap like some other offering. The case itself feels awesome, it has a aluminium feels and a weight that convey quality.The earbuds fits nicely in the ear. Although the fit doesn't feel as secure as other at first, when the eartips warms up, it creates a nice seal and won't move at all. The small size also help to makes the really comfortable for long listening time.The app is really good and since they've update it, they added manual EQ to customize the sound to fit your taste. ANC and transparency mode works really good. I wish the app had more customization on the tap features but it still does the job.About the sound, it has 1 dynamic driver for the lows/mids and 1 balanced armature for the high-mid/highs. Out of the box, it has a slight W shape that has probably too much highs and can be quite fatiguing. Bass is controlled and goes low, really low. You get some rumble that are really nice when going under 40hz.  Mids are quite nice but the dip at 3khz really hurts some details for vocals and instruments. I had to play with the manual EQ to make them enjoyable, bring the mids to life and tame the highs to soften the treble response.Soundstage and instrument separation are quite good for TWS earbuds. It still can't compete with some similarly priced wired IEM but still enjoyable for a earbuds on the go.Overall really impressed with these earbuds. I'm a audiophile that love great music details and a balanced sound signature and these satisfy my needs. If you're looking for a good TWS earbuds with all the features you need without paying 300$, this is a good buy.

The earbuds have pretty amazing sound output after the sound ID setup, I was impressed by the balanced sound, good and responsive bass, warm treble.They are pretty discrete in the ear, but you begin to feel ear fatigue after sometime.Single tap is disabled on the ear buds so the control options are somewhat limited.I was a bit disappointed about the ANC or ambient mode not working on a single bud, you must have both in to use those.I wish manufacturers would give us find my earbuds options on the case, I misplaced my sets after a week of use

reviewTitle: Amazing sound in a small package
reviewDescription: These earbuds are good. Small and lightweight with good sound quality. Crisp and clean with a good amount of bass when listening to music.4.5/5 Overall, great music experience, good noise cancellation, very good mic, good battery life, good size case (feels very solid), good variety of eq options that really enhance the sound.Grab them when they are on sale. It's worth it.

I would like to give 1 More Evo 4.5 stars rather than 4, but the system does not allow it.Pros: Sounds better to me with Sound ID, multipoint connection, comfortable, good noise cancellation, LDAC, wireless and wired charging, responsive customer service.Cons: Nothing major. I noticed that LDAC drains the battery life faster.
Amazing sound, and so far great quality

reviewTitle: Great sound but wind noise is pretty bad with anc
reviewDescription: Sounds great, first anc headphones so cant compare but turning it on definitely has a big impact on outside noise. Connection with my phone is seamless whether using one or both headphones. Only negative is any wind is very noisy with anc on like when you record a video in a windy environment
Ljudet är kanon men jag tycker att brusreduceringen ganska dålig faktiskt. Jämfört med Apple AirPods Pro t.ex så är de rent usla.
Application mobile 1More à chier

reviewTitle: Du Hi-Res Audio, mais toujours pas au niveau
reviewDescription: Les XM4 de Sony sont d'excellents intra-auriculaires Bluetooth si on les utilise avec les codecs audio de base comme l'AAC, mais ne sont malheureusement toujours pas au niveau dès qu'on passe au codec LDAC, sensé être la porte d'entrée de l'audio Hi-Res. Sur un Sony Xperia 5 IV : Déconnexions intempestives dès que quelqu'un en Bluetooth passe à côté de vous, micro coupures sans crier gare, son perfectible (et oui, faire passer du 24bit / 96 kHz sur une bande passante de moins d'un mégabit seconde, c'est pas sans compromis !).Bref, je suis repassé à du filaire, et je vais encore continuer longtemps, tant que les normes Bluetooth n'évolueront pas, ou que les écouteurs WiFi seront abordables.

reviewTitle: Very good sound...not so good options and BT conductivity
reviewDescription: I've been using these earbuds for the past six(6) months and this is my experience with them.  They've been used listening to different genres of music.  I listen to metal/extreme metal, rock, 70s adult contemporary, popular/dance music, disco, rap and classical...just to name a few.  I have some Jabras and Beats earbuds and prefer using the 1more for sound quality, but like the options of the other manufacturers.The bass sound on these really shine with the bone crushing bass in technical death metal. The sound of the mids and highs are great with all types of music and sound well-rounded. Overall the sound on these earbuds are very good.  The quality of the sound they produce also depend on the source of your audio.  I've used them listening to CD quality audio and online sourced music and found a difference.  The CD audio sounds more full.  The bass is deep and the highs are crystal clear and everything in-between sounds great.Options:I do have issues with BT connection being choppy depending on where on my body I have my 1+10 PRO or sixth Gen iPod with CD quality audio.  The sound degrades at times and cuts out for a few seconds.  I think this has to do with the source device, since this didn't happen with my S22.  The interference usually happens on my walks outside.  I usually don't use the ANC outside, since it doesn't work with higher frequency sounds like wind whistling and birds chirping.  In my experience the ANC is only usable inside.  If it is windy outside I always have to wear a winter hat or earmuffs over my ears to silence the wind noise.I also recommend cleaning them often with hydrogen peroxide, since this will also affect the sound quality.  My left side stopped working, so I cleaned it before contacting the seller and it worked.  The wax from your ears will plug the screens on them, so clean them at least once a month.  I use a cotton tip dipped in peroxide and brushed light across the screen with the earbud tips removed.The hear through is handy and works well and is turned on by holding your finger on the bud face for 3secs.  The button on these are conductive, so they don't work with gloves on.  Would be better if they had a physical button to push with single tap active.  The button double and triple touch allocations work okay.  Like many I pull them out to pause, which doesn't work that well.  The photo sensor used isn't very reliable, even if you put them in a pocket.  I end up having to use the pause on the device I'm using.  I have other earbuds that work a lot better and shutoff the whole time they're out.The fit of them is great and they are really comfortable.  I barely can feel them while they're in.  It's nice having the ability to have different tip sizes, since my ear canals are different sizes.  The tips don't lock in place and do have a habit of turning, so they need to be checked regularly.  This will affect the fitment and will allow outside noise in and music out, which you don't want.  I can usually tell when they do turn and have to remove, reposition and reinstall them.The battery life and charger are good for what I need.  I listen to music throughout the day and usually get the listed listening/charging times, so no complaints there.  Phone calls are good while inside, but haven't used them outside in windy conditions.The app is okay and is functional.  The adaptive sound option is great for listening to different genres of music.  This allows you to fine tune the music equalization to your ears and create different types of listening experiences.Overall, I listen to these strictly for the sound they produce and not for the options.  Wish I got them now that they're cheaper than the price I paid.Hope this helps.

I really liked these earbuds.  Good sound, good fit, good battery life.  There were a couple of issues.  The app could be better.  Often, the earbuds would go into noise cancellation mode on its own.  But the benefits outweighed the negatives.  Until, my left earbud stopped working out of nowhere.  On average, I use these 2 times a week, if that, so I am not a heavy user.  In my opinion, these should last a lot longer than 9 months of light use.

reviewTitle: Sound is amazing, app isn't so amazing, fit is...
reviewDescription: The basic features like ANC, Transparency, all that is good, very good. Sound quality (after sound id) is very rich in bass and though a little dark works well with pretty much every track I've tested. The app acts and looks like a thrown together piece of software. The new eq doesn't give as much bass as the Sound ID does, and the touch controls are still limited. The REAL problem I have with these is the fit. I think of comfort as 2 things:1 - they don't feel uncomfortable in the ear2 - "they fit nicely and don't feel like they will fall out easily".These, are very light and very comfortable in that way, but oh boy do they fapl out easily. No matter what tip I use, how I put them in, or how I wiggle them around in my ear, after shaking my head for 5-10 seconds they fall out. Its probably just MY ears, because apparently the oval design of the tip is supposed to be more fitting for the ear. Just because of that lack of fit (and lack of a better app) I'm rating these earbuds 6/10.
I tried all the ear tips they came along with it kept on falling... they didn't even got sealed

My biggest concern is the always crashing app, impossible to use.Oval eartip.. really! Weird ideology.I put the XL size one's for a good seal, I'm usually using medium tips.I can't swap for my favorite tips.Sound is okay for the price

reviewTitle: Ne tiens pas dans mes oreilles trop lourde
reviewDescription: J’ai retourné l’article car il n’était pas confortable à mes oreilles

My biggest gripe is having one earbud charge, while the other fails to charge. My second biggest gripe is one earbud synching to my device, while the other fails to synch.Beyond that, these are fine. The noise cancelling is excellent.These are the third earbuds I've purchased at a less accessible price point. One had a neck band, two were wireless. One wireless pair were returned almost immediately because they failed my expectations on the features I pay most attention to (comfort, sound, noise cancellation)I've found I dislike wireless, and hope to return to a neckband when these ultimately die.
Skönt ljud med bra balans.Många samtal där mottagaren klagar på dålig mikrofon.

Der Klang diese Earbuds ist durchaus ausgewogen: vielleicht etwas mehr Betonung auf den mittleren und hohen Lagen als zum Beispiel bei den Airpods Pro, aber das ist natürlich subjektiv; apropos: Die Verarbeitung ist sauber, das Material wertig und die Teile sitzen bequem - allerdings würde ich sie nicht bei Aktivsportarten tragen. Aaaaaber: Die Bedienung ist alles andere als intuitiv. Das übliche am-Earbud-klöpfeln (1 x für Stop, 2 x Skip, 3 x zurück, Halten = Wechsel ANC / Transparent, ...) brachte leider nix. Entweder wurde der laufende Track gestoppt oder die Sprachbedienung aktiviert und einmal gelang es sogar, in den transparenten Modus zu wechseln. In der Anleitung fand ich keinen Hinweis auf ein weiteres Funktionsspektrum. Ich gehe also davon aus, daß zur Bedieung die dazugehörige App vonnöten ist. Und das ist leider der Grund für nur drei Sterne.

Bonjour,Bon produit mais pas phénoménal.Le son n'est pas terrible avant d'avoir installé une application avec laquelle vous pouvez concocter votre propre profil d'égalisation qui est ensuite représenté par un symbole.On as même pas de vue sur la courbe d'égalisation créé, ou acces à l'égaliseur en question. Mais après ce penible moment obligatoire, le son est très correct.La réduction du bruit fonctionne, mais pas assez à mon goût, ne les acheter pas si ceci est le plus important pour vous.Si vous utiliser la réduction du bruit seule sans musique ou autre source audio, vous avez un bruit de white noise (genre de souffle) très agaçant.Ils sont très légères, et ne pose aucun problème pour de longues périodes d'écoute.Je leurs donne que 3 étoiles, car beaucoup de choses pourraient encore être amélioré avec une mise à jour du firmware.

reviewTitle: Best Earbuds I have ever heard...!
reviewDescription: I'm a reference audiofile type of person and takes my Audio listening very serious. My home audio systems are very high quality and I use to own my own recording studio as well as work at Stereo People back in the 1988. Anyway, I've listened to and sampled many high quality headphones and earbuds in my lifetime. I currently have six different name brands of headphones and earbuds. They are all high quality. One pair is the legendary AKG 240 studio series headphones. Even though they all sound Very good and each has its own sound characteristics, the 1MORE Evo earbuds are simply the best set from all of them. I've also sampled many more high end earbuds before settling on the 1MORE EVOs. I cannot state enough how much I luv them!They fit excellent and are very comfortable to the point that I forget I have them on sometimes, and the sound is literally sublime! I bought a second pair (the first in black and the second in white) after hearing the first set for a month or so. I just couldn't believe the immersive, uncolored and crystal clear sound quality I was hearing without any fatigue what-so-ever. The soundstsge is oh so wonderful... In the interest of keeping this short, they are simply amazing! Especially if you factor in cost plus what the competition has to offer. I would have gladly paid double or triple for the second pair without hesitation. I'm considering a third pair as I write this review. My good friend also  bought a black pair for himself and constantly thanks me for the recommendation. They are That Good!Great options as well like ANC, LDAC, HI Res, Touch, 1MORE App, Great Case, Cordless Charging, High Quality, Good Looks, etc.The only thing that I wish was the same is that the rose gold circular lining that's on the black set was the same color rose gold circular lining on the white set. However, the white set has gold color circular lining, not rose gold like the black set. Other than that they're perfect!And, No! No one has sponsored this review.I'll have 1MORE please 🙏 🙂

reviewTitle: Excellent quality and features for a good price
reviewDescription: I've been a fan of 1More's Quad driver headphones for some time and were waiting for something similar to come out for wireless buds.These hit the mark and have a good set of features with excellent sound.After the 1More Quad's, I went to the Sony wf-1000xm3.  These are pretty good, but had a number of issues with ANC, functionality (lots of connection and other issues) and battery life.So far all the issues that were present in the Sony's are not apparent in the 1More'sThe size of the buds and charge case are smaller then the Sony's.Sound quality (to my ears) is superior.  Not a huge fan of the automatic equalizer - I finally found something that works, but would prefer to fiddle with the settings myselfANC is fantastic.  Took a trip downtown on the subway (metro) and fiddled with the ANC settings.  They did an excellent job of filtering out the noise.  Wind noise walking outside was especially good.Battery life seems to be pretty good so far.Buds look well built and have a premium feel** added a picture comparing size of the 1More and Sony casesOverall, excellent quality for the price.

I am coming from XM3 headphones to wireless earphones, after some research I narrowed down my choice to 1More - they seem to have really good products when it comes to earbuds in all budget categoriesWhy I choose this one?They are not too big - comfort is key, and while they will hurt your ear if you eat or laugh after some time, they are more comfy than the other bulkier optionsStyle - earphones are accessory as well, if it doesn't look good - you will look out of the place, so go according to your ear size/style/head shape etcQuality of music is outstanding - no overpowering bass - music has to be all around good, not bass heavy - if you are a musician you know - melody is more important, bass is just a nice add on/highlightCase - very small and nice case, fits nicely in a pocket/small bagGood microphone - maybe not the best, but no one is the best unfortunately, but so far I haven't had people complaining on the other line - so seems to work, and even in wind people haven't had issue hearing my voice or hearing the windANC - Good, what can I say, it does the job, and it's earbud with silicone - but all earphone/headphones are good in ANC soConnectivity/motion controls - there is no 1 tap, for some it might be an issue, for me I fix my earbud a lot, so accidental touches are more of an issue for me - so I am good with no 1 touch control. Everything else works very well, connecting out of the case to 2 devices, 1 earbud listening, taking out 1 and pausing something - all of those features work flawlesy to my suprise actuallyCONSNo Equilizer - but this is easily fixed, just download a 3rd party EQ and it does the job - but I do hope 1More can update their app to include an EQ - you guys can do it, please work on the software

reviewTitle: Excellent ANC and Sound Quality. Amazing Value!
reviewDescription: ANC is most excellent. The sound quality - superb. I like the app and the ability to tailor the sound to your preference easily with soundID. Incredible value. Well done, 1More. I also have the wired triple driver buds, again, excellent in all areas for the price point. Won't disappoint!

reviewTitle: It is superb for the money
reviewDescription: My 12-year-old son has recently become crazy about pop music. As an audiophile for decades, I think I should choose a good earphone for him so that he can know what is really listening to music from an early age. I gave him an Airpods Max for Christmas last year. But I found that he rarely used it because it was too heavy to wear comfortably for a long time. I think he needs a noise-canceling earbuds.I received the 1More Evo from Amazon the day after I placed the order. Both noise-cancelling and sound quality are excellent. The Evo produce one of the most dynamic, detailed and balanced performances I've heard. Bass notes sound tight and textured, while vocals ooze refinement and sophistication.Evo are comfortable to wear too. The touch controls on each bud are responsive and intuitive, allowing you to control your music and switch between noise-cancelling modes with zero fuss. Last week we took a 15 hours flight trip, both with Airpod Max and Evo. I compared the noise reduction on the plane, the Airpod Max was slightly better, but I wore the Evo for the entire trip because it was so comfortable to wear. The slightest difference in noise reduction can be completely ignored.1More isn't a brand that immediately springs to mind when you think of the best wireless earbuds. But perhaps it should be. If you want the new benchmark for wireless earbuds, this is it. It is superb for the money.
Just purchased a second pair of these - they're the best Bluetooth earbuds I've ever heard.

Reçu le colis dans les temps. Les 1mores sont vraiment impressionnant a différent point de vu. Qualité de produit haut de gamme, le son est riche et très équilibré. La basse est ne prend pas le dessus mais d'une très bonne profondeur. Écouter un film en 4k son et image est malade, on sent le transfert de son d'une oreille à l'autre. En fait, je retrouve la même richesse que sur mon cinéma maison Bose. Le seule bémol, j'ai eu un peu de douleur à une des deux oreille mais après l'utilisation 2-3 fois tout était vraiment comfortable et ce sur une longue période. Contrairement a mes anciennes Samsung Bud live pro. En utilisation en mode téléphone marche très bien et les gens me comprenaient clairement et aussi bon sinon meilleur que les bud live  et mes bose sport. Bref, je recommande vu l'énorme qualité versus prix
The sound is amazing! Really a good pair for the price

So I bought these AirPods 3gen and the bloody things can’t stay in my ear. So I bought these after I bought the girls a couple of piston bud pros. I started my evening with some Jon Pardi, followed by snoop, cypress, Danzig, Ramones, yngwie . The bass is solid the mids are clear, the highs could use a little more brightness but definitely acceptable. Good Phones

Love these.  So east to connect to my iPhone.  After a month of use they’ve yet to loose connection like other ear buds I’ve used.  One charge of the case lasts me about a work week.  I probably listen 2-4 hours a day. Quite comfortable, I have small ears and these are quite nice.  Multiple sizes to choose from.  But most importantly they sound great.  A nice rich full sound.  And you can do a test to optimize for your preferences! Highly recommend. I did hours of research before deciding on these and many different folks recommended these as a best bang for your buck.

reviewTitle: Sounds worse than the previous generation
reviewDescription: These sound worse than the previous Tone Free line up. In addition the plug and play feature bugs out to the point you have to reset the headset to get it to work. Multipoint works well and is very easy to control through the tone free app. ANC from what I can tell sounds the same as my tone free fp-8. If anyone is thinking of getting these I’d suggest to get the previous iteration.

reviewTitle: Another great product from lg, with ghost advertising.
reviewDescription: Lg made my perfect earbuds; great battery life, most comfortable fit for smaller ears, stays in my ears, waterproof, sound really good, case is small and nifty with a cool outside texture. Tried both Sony and technics and returned them for these. Two gripes,1 sound quality for calls could be improved, but not bad at all. Connection from wireless case to headphone jack is a great idea, but can be very glitchy, and was disappointed I didn't notice that you can't use your microphone while using that feature. Thought it would be great for ps4. Despite these gripes these have finally converted a diehard wired headphone user to causal part-time wired headphone user.The strange thing is no one knows about these gem, s just like their awesome phones.There is sponsored YouTube reviews, but if you dont know about them in the first place, they are easy to not stumble apon. I was lucky enough a bestbuy employee was knowledgeable to know they even existed and he thought they were designed for TV use. I own a velvet and owned other lg phones so I figured I'd put down some research. If anything, the sponsored videos worried me, luckly, my intuition to give them a try was right. Lg, your products are fantastic, but fire your marketing.

I've never had earbuds with ANC before and I have to say it's a game changer. Got these since my old earbuds were constantly falling out of my ears but these stay nice and snug. My only gripe is that they seem to pick up lots of wind noise on even mildly windy days. This happens regardless of if the ANC is off so it might just be due to their shape. Otherwise I love them!
They are comfortable in my ears. Becareful because you can used to having them on and forget about them. I lost two this way. But I really like these so I bought another pair.
A1 raport qualité prix un petit bijoux que du bonheur

reviewTitle: Excellent all around headphones, though the case size and ANC quality are not ideal
reviewDescription: -the fins work great for me, these are not going anywhere, I fend them very comfortable for extended listening-connection and multipoint (android phone, windows PC) was seamless, and I had no latency issues watching youtube videos-Tonefree app (again Android) super uninvasive, reasonable customisatation of touch controls and full custom EQ options-Sound quality is great, I don't listen to bass heavy music so the natural preset works well for me for music and podcasts-downsides: the ANC is very minimal, almost hard to detect it is actually on. If ANC is a must for you and not a bonus feature, look somewhere else.-The case is large in all dimensions so it is not easily pocketable if that an important consideration for you.I upgraded to these from Samsung galaxy buds and other than the disappointing ANC performance, These are comfy, they sound great, and they can be rinsed under the tap so I'm optimistic about them maintaining their performance and not getting gunked up.
We have had to send two sets back from one ear piece not working. But lg replaced them with no issues they are great headphones when working. . The app is horrible though. I don’t recommend the app
